com.password4j

Class PepperGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.password4j.PepperGenerator

  • public class PepperGenerator
extends Object
    This class contains static functions that help to create a secure pepper.

    In cryptography, a pepper is a secret added to a password prior to being hashed with a CHF.

    Since:
    0.1.1
    Author:
    David Bertoldi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static String generate()
      Generates a String that can be used as pepper by a CHF.
      static String generate(int length)
      Generates a String that can be used as pepper by a CHF.
      static String get()
      Peppers by definition are shared between all passwords and must be stored in a location different from the one used for the passwords.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public static String generate(int length)
        Generates a String that can be used as pepper by a CHF. The generated pepper is created by a cryptographically strong random number generator (RNG).

        The parameter length must be a non-negative number, otherwise a BadParametersException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        length - of the returned string
        Returns:
        a pepper of the given length
        Throws:
        BadParametersException - if the length is negative
        Since:
        0.1.1

      • generate

        public static String generate()
        Generates a String that can be used as pepper by a CHF. The generated pepper is created by a cryptographically strong random number generator (RNG).

        The pepper generated is 24 characters long.

        Returns:
        a pepper as String
        Since:
        0.1.1

      • get

        public static String get()
        Peppers by definition are shared between all passwords and must be stored in a location different from the one used for the passwords.

        It can be set in the psw4j.properties file with the property global.pepper.

        If the psw4j.properties or the property global.pepper are not found, null is returned.

        Returns:
        a shared pepper set in the psw4j.properties file.
        Since:
        0.1.1
